content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────
### Extraction System at position (–3.5, 27.5)
Consists of:
– An extraction system burner inserter located at (–3.5, 27.5) with its drop position at (–3.5, 28.5).

### Copper Cable Factory at approximately (2.5, 17.5)
Consists of:
– A cable factory input chest at (2.5, 17.5).
– A burner inserter retrieved at (2.5, 16.5).
– A burner inserter placed at (3.5, 17.5) using direction RIGHT adjacent to the input chest.
– An assembling machine at (1.5, 19.5) linked as a neighbor to the factory inserters.

### Belt Depot at position (3.5, 15.5)
Consists of:
– A wooden chest placed at (3.5, 15.5) serving as the belt depot.
– A dedicated transport belt segment placed at (4.5, 15.5) adjacent to the chest.
– A depot burner inserter placed at (3.5, 14.5) using direction UP next to the depot chest.

ERROR TIPS
────────────
• When connecting transport belts, the target must be a valid inserter—not a Prototype.SteamEngine. Always insert an intermediary inserter to serve as the proper target and avoid connecting directly to non‐target entities.

• Placement errors due to distance:
 – If an entity (e.g. a wooden chest) cannot be placed because the target position is too far from the player, ensure that the player moves close enough so that the distance is within allowable limits.

• Variable reference issues:
 – NameErrors such as an undefined “target_chest” indicate that variable names must be correctly defined and referenced before use.

• Inventory shortages:
 – Errors reporting “No wooden_chest in inventory” require verifying that the required item is present in the inventory before attempting placement.
